post_text: Teachers have such an impact on so many people. From encouraging a student who is finding it hard to understand a lesson or life, to going the extra mile when someone is having a rough day. It takes a special person to be that kind of a serving individual that loves leading in that unique way. This is our chance to thank as many as you can...or even just a single teacher that's meant a lot to you. Teachers can even thank other teachers that have mentored them in being better. We've all been impacted by a great teacher, thank you SLPS staff!

post_text: May 1 is National Principals Day and Spring Lake Public Schools would like to thank and honor the Principals, Assistant Principals, and leaders that serve in these roles. Throughout the school year, these educators assume the commitment to lead our young people to a prosperous future. They support and guide quality teachers and staff resulting in productive learning environments for our children. Thank you for your dedication to our students, staff, and community. #SchoolPrincipalsDay
shared_text:
NATIONALDAYCALENDAR.COM
SCHOOL PRINCIPALS’ DAY – May 1
text:
May 1 is National Principals Day and Spring Lake Public Schools would like to thank and honor the Principals, Assistant Principals, and leaders that serve in these roles. Throughout the school year, these educators assume the commitment to lead our young people to a prosperous future. They support and guide quality teachers and staff resulting in productive learning environments for our children. Thank you for your dedication to our students, staff, and community. #SchoolPrincipalsDay

post_text:
It's a great day to be a Laker. Congratulations to:

3x State Champion Bella LeRoux, who broke the State record in the pole vault!

4x200 relay team of Julia Bajt, Gabriella LeRoux, Sophia Tardini, and Kiara Stephenson took 2nd in the State!

Isaiah Pierce finished 6th in the 400 meters, and finished 5th in the 200 meters earning all-state in both events!

The High School girls soccer team who captured the district championship beating Fruitport 3-0!

The High School girls softball team won the district game beating Coopersville 15-3!

The High School girls tennis team finished the season top 10 in the State!

The boys golf team qualified for the State meet with Nick Krueger shooting 71, and earning medalist honors at the regional meet!

Congratulations to all the coaches, athletes, and families. Go Lakers!
text:
It's a great day to be a Laker. Congratulations to:

3x State Champion Bella LeRoux, who broke the State record in the pole vault!

4x200 relay team of Julia Bajt, Gabriella LeRoux, Sophia Tardini, and Kiara Stephenson took 2nd in the State!

Isaiah Pierce finished 6th in the 400 meters, and finished 5th in the 200 meters earning all-state in both events!

The High School girls soccer team who captured the district championship beating Fruitport 3-0!

The High School girls softball team won the district game beating Coopersville 15-3!

The High School girls tennis team finished the season top 10 in the State!

The boys golf team qualified for the State meet with Nick Krueger shooting 71, and earning medalist honors at the regional meet!

Congratulations to all the coaches, athletes, and families. Go Lakers!

post_text: Congratulations to the High School Boys Cross Country Team and Ms. Julia Bajt who competed at the MHSAA State meet today at Jackson Motor Speedway. The boy's finished 12th in the state and Andrew Hylen earned special honors as a first team All-State runner for finishing 21st (out of more than 240 runners) with a time of 16:14. Great job to all of the runners and coaches on a great season!

The boy's finished 12th in the state and Andrew Hylen earned special honors as a first team All-State runner for finishing 21st (out of more than 240 runners) with a time of 16:14. Great job to all of the runners and coaches on a great season!

post_text:
November 1st is recognized as National Family Literacy Day. First held in 1994, National Literacy Day is a kickoff of National Literacy Month.

There are many activities families can engage in that help children develop literacy skills that are important for a lifetime of reading and learning. Below is a link that may be of interest to you. It gives ideas of how families can incorporate reading and literacy activities into their daily lives.

Challenge your families to celebrate on Nov. 1st.
1. Read together
2. Have their child write a letter to someone (grandparent, neighbor)
3. Play a word game (Scrabble)
4. Make a list of their top 10 favorite books
5. Have their child write the grocery list
6. Come up with a new ending to a favorite book

The options are endless. Have fun celebrating literacy everyday!
shared_text:
BOOKSOURCEBANTER.COM
7 Family-Friendly Literacy Activities to Empower Families as Readers

It gives ideas of how families can incorporate reading and literacy activities into their daily lives.

post_text:
SLXC Jogs for Dogs/Beeline for the Felines Day-
This Tuesday, October 11th, the Spring Lake Girls Cross Country team will be visiting four legged friends at the Muskegon Humane Society. They will take the adoptable dogs out for a jog and then spend time with the adoptable cats for much needed play time. They are asking for donations of food, toys, blankets, treats, cleaning supplies, or money to bring with them. We would love to surprise the MHS with tons of gifts. If you are interested in donating, contributions can be dropped off at Spring Lake High School or contact Coach Aaron Andres at aandres@springlakeschools.org.

After two weather cancellations forced the Band Festival to be rescheduled, the middle and high school bands finally got to perform yesterday!

All four bands received FIRST DIVISION ratings which is as high as you can get. Even better, all bands earned straight A's in all subcategories and were praised by multiple judges for quality of play and maturity.

Congrats to all SLPS Bands!

Their next big things is a fundraising concert on Sunday - music, auctions, and Pronto Pups! For more information, please visit http://springlakebands.org/archives/2335

post_text:
Be sure to put the Shindig on your calendar April 30th at 6pm. It's a fun time for great cause - your kids!!

The Spring Lake Public Schools has begun to see the positive effects of the new 5-12 grade math curriculum funded by the Shindig in 2013. The Spring Lake High School ACT math composite has jumped from 21.7 to 22.1 and our High School Advanced Placement Calculus composite score has risen from 2.1 to 3.1 from 2013 to 2015, a 32% increase. Furthermore, 5-8 grade Discovery Education Assessments in math have risen by an average of 18 points.

The Shindig proceeds this year will give our K-4 students us that same needed math curriculum upgrade. Get your Shindig tickets today! http://slsf.schoolauction.net/shindig

SLSF.SCHOOLAUCTION.NET

post_text: Recent studies link regular family dinners with many behaviors that parents pray for: lower rates of substance abuse, teen pregnancy and depression, as well as higher grade-point averages and self-esteem. Studies also indicate that dinner conversation is a more potent vocabulary-booster than reading, and the stories told around the kitchen table help our children build resilience. The icing on the cake is that regular family meals also lower the rates of obesity and eating disorders in children and adolescents. See what kids have to say!

post_text:
Arleen's Last Day
Why Spring Lake? The MIGHTY and AWESOME Laker Band and their directors remind me, once again, how lucky I am to live and work in such a wonderful community.

Check out the Laker Marching Band as they send off (in style) the incomparable Arleen Cox on this, her last day of work.

29 years with SLPS as the administrative assistant to the superintendent...just doesn't happen like that any longer.

Farewell Mrs. Cox....

post_text:
Two great opportunities in early September to celebrate with family, friends, and community! Construction and site work at the new turf fields and Grabinski continue to be on schedule and the results continue to exceed expectations. Please consider joining us as we 'cut the ribbons' and open these new fields for our student-athletes.

These projects are the first to be completed from our May 2014 Bond and the District wants to extend the most heart-felt thanks to the SL community for their outstanding support.

More details later....but, mark your calendars! And: Go Lakers!

Construction Update: If you haven't been by Holmes or Jeffers lately, take your family on a walk, bike ride, or drive and check out the progress! The two story academic wing for grades K-4 is climbing out of the foundation and the building's layout is evident.

The attached images show a bird's eye view of both buildings, the future layout, and an updated timeline.

Both projects remain on schedule for a fall of 2016 opening!

This school year will be a little hectic for students and staff - BUT well worth any snags along the way as the 2016-17 year and beyond will include two of the nicer elementary buildings to be found...anywhere.

Go Lakers!

post_text:
Construction Update: needing to share some fantastic images of the premier place to play football in West Michigan! Home to Laker Football and the finest marching band around.

These images were captured this week from a drone that circled the field.

As you can see, progress has been significant toward our target of re-opening the field in late August. Work that is proceeding includes the removal of overgrowth around the field so that, once again, you can enjoy views of Grand River while taking in the band, football, and cheerleaders.

Look for information about the ribbon cutting soon: it's a football field so...we're thinking a 'Tailgate Ribbon Cutting at Grabinski' might be in order.

Status of this project: on target and within budget!

Go Lakers!

post_text:
Construction Update: Spring Lake Middle School

How do you renovate 70,000 square feet in 3 months? One key is to have the proper equipment onsite with a coordinated plan. Never more evident than today. Pictures below give a glimpse of the equipment in use today at SLMS as construction crews continue their summer-long sprint.

Still in the tear down mode in many spaces within the building, but window frames going in on the west side of the building and blocks being set within the new Intermediate Office. Duct work is laid out in many rooms and installed in a few.

Three plus weeks of summer in the books and progress continues to amaze.

Status of projects: on schedule, still plenty to remove and breakdown, but some areas being rebuilt/renovated.

Go Lakers!

Go Lakers!

post_text:
Construction Update: visited Holmes, Jeffers, and HS this morning. Pictures are below, including a few renderings to give you a taste of where we are headed.

The pictures from Holmes include the sheer wall that is part of the entry, also featured in the attached rendering. The other pictures include one of the walls enclosing the music room & teacher's lounge as well as one of the floor for the gym & cafeteria.

The HS pictures include the LAX field which is now filled-in with the sub material, the soccer field awaiting a carpet (done by mid-July) and a rendering of the same.

The Jeffers pictures show the floor being poured for the gym & cafeteria.

Next week we should see the new presser at Grabinski go UP, bleachers at LAX/Soccer, continued masonry at Holmes, starting masonry at Jeffers.

Status of projects: on time, on budget, amazing.

post_text:
Summer Learning: K-8 staff are in the midst of a summer of learning! With 1:1 devices scheduled to be distributed to students in the fall for the first time, staff are being trained throughout the summer at Communication by Design in Ada, MI.

Once school has started, shoulder-to-shoulder training will be offered to support teachers as they operationalize their new learning.

While technology is not the only tool, or even the best in many instances, it is none the less a game changer in education. The capacity of staff to manage & prepare curriculum, deliver effective instruction, and assess students in real time is dramatically different in a technology infused classroom.

If you see one of our K-8 teachers at the beach or around town this summer, ask them:

How will 1:1 technology transform student learning?

What are your personal goals in terms of technology integration for next year?

When isn't technology the best tool? When is it?

What are you most excited about when it comes to teaching with technology?

A few artifacts and pictures from training...

post_text:
Construction update from LAX & Soccer Fields: 83 days until the SLHS Varsity Boy's Soccer team takes on Reeths Puffer in the opening game at their new synthetic turf field!

You can see that progress has been IMPRESSIVE. Teams on site are laying the carpet on the LAX field now. Once the carpet is down, they sew the panels together before adding the infill and grooming. Right now it's a hard surface - once the infill is down, it will be softer & more plush, but still a fast surface for our athletes.

The soccer field is fully prepped and awaiting carpet. Light pole and scoreboard foundations are in the ground. And, the concessions stand is UP.

As I walked the site today, I was struck with the size of these fields and how perfectly they fit within the site: softball field to the southeast, trees framing three sides, the HS and FAC to the south. What a place to catch our Lakers in action!

Status of the project: on time and awesome!

Go Lakers!

Construction update from Grabinski Field: Just 88 days until the 2015 season home opener against the Holland Dutch! Much work remains to be done but it's beginning to take shape. Pictured: new entry; view from press box across field; view from press box back to entry; and, view from press box toward river & new team room.

The press box will be relocated across to the visitor's side in the coming weeks in order to make room for the new press box behind the home bleachers.

Status of projects: on time! Go Lakers!

post_text:
A great day for the Spring Lake High School Women's Track Team. Congratulations to the 4x100 team of Kiara Stevenson, Bella LeRoux, Sydney DeCator, and Paige Rubleski who finished third in their relay. Bella LeRoux is the Division 2 Pole Vault State Champion and Carlyn Artega won her second consecutive state championship in the 800 meter run. Overall the team finished third in the state. Congratulations Coach Peel, Coach Andres, and student athletes. A great day to be a Laker!

text:
A great day for the Spring Lake High School Women's Track Team. Congratulations to the 4x100 team of Kiara Stevenson, Bella LeRoux, Sydney DeCator, and Paige Rubleski who finished third in their relay. Bella LeRoux is the Division 2 Pole Vault State Champion and Carlyn Artega won her second consecutive state championship in the 800 meter run. Overall the team finished third in the state. Congratulations Coach Peel, Coach Andres, and student athletes. A great day to be a Laker!

post_text: The Spring Lake Middle and High School Choirs got to share the stage this evening with the Grammy-nominated Grand Rapids Symphony for a "Spotlight Concert". A special thanks to the Grand Haven Area Community Foundation for sponsoring this event for our students and community.
